intro: Oreodaphne mexicana var. subsessilis, commonly known as the Mexican oreodaphne, is a shrub or small tree native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and poison ivy. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically greenish-white in color, and it produces small, fleshy berries. This species is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils.
